fields.headline: Tour facts and figures
fields.bodyText: June 8 Western Australia (Perth) won 116-10. June 12 Queensland President's XV (Townsville) won 83-6. June 16 Queensland Reds (Brisbane) won 42-8. June 19 Australia A (Gosford) lost 25-28. June 23 New South Wales Waratahs (Sydney) won 41-24. June 26 New South Wales Country (Coffs Harbour) won 46-3. June 30 AUSTRALIA (Brisbane) won 29-13. July 3 ACT Brumbies (Canberra) won 30-28. July 7 AUSTRALIA (Melbourne) lost 14-35. July 14 AUSTRALIA (Sydney) lost 23-29. Total points scored: 449. Total points conceded: 184. Leading scorers: 72 Jonny Wilkinson (pictured); 50 Jason Robinson; 32 Neil Jenkins; 26 Ronan O'Gara; 21 Matt Dawson. Top tries: 10 Jason Robinson; 4 Austin Healey, Rob Henderson, Dan Luger, Brian O'Driscoll, Scott Quinnell; 3 Neil Back, Colin Charvis, Dafydd James. Most appearances (starts only): 6 Martin Corry, Danny Grewcock, Dafydd James, Brian O'Driscoll, Scott Quinnell, Jason Robinson, Phil Vickery, Keith Wood; 5 Neil Back, Rob Henderson, Martin Johnson, Matt Perry, Tom Smith, Jonny Wilkinson. Most appearances (as substitute): 5 Jason Leonard; 4 Iain Balshaw, Colin Charvis.
